text: William A. Shea Municipal Stadium, or more commonly Shea Stadium (often referred to in short as Shea), was a major league ballpark that was the home for the New York Mets 1964 to 2008 when the Mets left for their new home Citi Field. Shea was also the home of the New York Yankees while Yankee Stadium was being renovated for the 1974 and 1975 seasons. It was demolished between October 14, 2008 and February 18, 2009. ==References== Category:1964 establishments in New York (state) Category:2009 disestablishments in New York (state) Category:Former Major League Baseball venues Category:Former National Football League venues Category:New York Mets Category:New York Yankees Category:Queens (New York City) Category:Sports buildings in New York City
title: Shea Stadium
